intro: Hieracium sarcophylloton, commonly known as the purple spearthistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and large, showy purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are deep and fibrous. Hieracium sarcophylloton is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
